frameDefinitions: A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.
An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer.
A Goal has a Source from which it has gotten a Theme.
An Entity undergoes some change (the Event) that is (or is construed as) punctual.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source.
frameExamples: The claimant should then submit medical certificates for the duration of their <t>absence</t> from work.INI
Liquid water was <t>present</t> on the surface of Mars billions of years ago.
she is my friend...not to mention my <t>source</t> for French madeleines!
This <t>happens</t> to me all the time.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen> of time.
This role describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the <fen>Person</fen> is taking a temporary leave.
The amount of time the <fen>Person</fen> is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen>.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:
The time at which the leave occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose existence at the <fen>Location</fen> is confirmed.
The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is present at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The abstact or concrete thing acquired by the <fen>Goal</fen> from the <fen>Source</fen>.
A concrete or abstract entity from which the <fen>Goal</fen> has gotten the <fen>Theme</fen>.
An entity or individual that has acquired a <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Source</fen>.
This role identifies the event which occurs and affects the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the entity, concrete or abstract.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
This role identifies where the event takes place.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
This is the object which moves. It may be an entity which moves under its own power, but it need not be.

All the verbs in this frame express some change of location, away from one place and to another. Any constituent that expresses the initial position of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before the change of location, is tagged with <fen>Source</fen>. Often the <fen>Source</fen> is understood from context.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the departure takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the departing takes place.
listRoleExamples: During his <fex>wife's</fex> absence, Linkworth and his mother had another violent argument.
Such conditions would be likely to lead to absence <fex>from work</fex>.
Dissuaded from resigning, Macmillan took <fex>extended</fex> leave rather than restrain his public utterances.
Columbus took leave of the known world <fex>on 6 September 1492</fex>.
The sun doesn't burn up because its source <fex>of power</fex> is nuclear energy.
<fex>Dr Kelly</fex> is his source for the specific information relating to phlogiston production.
The beetles thereby cut off <fex>the tree's</fex> source of nourishment and it dies.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.
